newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Aztech to put suit provision in 1996 figs.
newsitem.headline: Aztech to put suit provision in 1996 figs.

text.p: Aztech Systems Ltd said on Tuesday it intended to put an estimate of the cost of its copyright suit with Creative Technology in its 1996 accounts.

Aztech director Mun Hon Pheng told reporters after a products preview that the estimate would be made against the company's general provisions in its 1996 accounts. He said Aztech had not yet decided what the estimate would be.
Singapore's Court of Appeal ruled in November 1996 Aztech had infringed the copyright of its rival Creative's eight-bit computer sound card software.
The court told Aztech not to disassemble Creative's firmware for its popular "Sound Blaster" sound cards and ordered it to pay unspecified costs and damages to be announced at a later date.
Mun said it was reasonable to expect the final results of the judgement to be given this year.
If the provisions made in 1996 were insufficient, additional provisions would be carried into 1997, he said.
Some reports had earlier estimated the cost of the suit to Aztech at between Singapore $20 million and S$40 million but the company dismissed such figures as being "without any basis."
It said it expected to pay only "modest" damages.
